definition: to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
my (polite)/poor/ruined/shabby/worn out/defeated
eye/item/section/list/catalogue/table of contents/order (taxonomy)/goal/name/title
glance/glimpse
to glimpse

sentences.english: It was just one glance, but its beauty stole my breath away.
sentences.chinese: 我只不過瞥了一眼，但是它的美卻令我讚歎不已。

sentences.english: The mourners around me give me sideways glances or just stare.
sentences.chinese: 我周圍的哀悼者斜着瞥我一眼或者乾脆直盯着我看。

sentences.english: He glanced repeatedly at his watch.
sentences.chinese: 他不時對手錶瞥上一眼。

sentences.english: “Hmm,” he said, glancing at me, his expression skeptical.
sentences.chinese: “嗯，”他應答着，瞥了我一眼，一副懷疑的表情。

sentences.english: Listen to cost no intentionally query words, quickly elevated heaved eye Pie the east of the eye brocade.
sentences.chinese: 聽着花無心的問話，急忙擡眼瞥了眼東方錦。

sentences.english: River the vegetable Pie wear a summer rather, this woman what vision is that ?
sentences.chinese: 江素瞥着夏寧，這女人那是什麼目光？

sentences.english: I drew my coat around me and tightened its belt and as I did so I glanced at Parry's shoes.
sentences.chinese: 我拉緊外套，束緊腰帶，這時，我瞥了一眼帕裏的鞋。

sentences.english: I saw my wife glance up at me.
sentences.chinese: 我看到我的妻子瞥了我一眼。

sentences.english: " the judge asked, glancing at Dennis's lawyer, who lifted his eyebrows hopelessly.
sentences.chinese: 法官問道，瞥到丹尼斯的律師絕望地挑着眉。

sentences.english: From the corner of his eyes, Jack saw a flash outside the window. Hensley saw it, too.
sentences.chinese: 傑克眼角的餘光瞥到窗外有道閃光，漢斯萊也看見了。

sentences.english: Her father gave a lazy leer.
sentences.chinese: 她父親懶懶的瞥了她一眼。

sentences.english: He glances up at the moon; time's a-wasting.
sentences.chinese: 他擡頭瞥了一眼月亮，時間過得真快。

sentences.english: Wheat title Pie the Xiao wing is one eye, she naturally understands the meaning of Xiao wing.
sentences.chinese: 阿麥擡頭瞥了肖翼一眼，她自是明白肖翼的意思。

sentences.english: I glanced at my son busily coloring a picture.
sentences.chinese: 我瞥了一眼喬納森，他正忙着畫一幅畫。

sentences.english: I glanced at the noncommital green numerals flashing on the nearby digital clock.
sentences.chinese: 我瞥了一眼旁邊數字時鐘上沒有意義的綠色數字閃光。

sentences.english: Dumbledore cast a quick glance at the unconscious Professor Burns.
sentences.chinese: 鄧布利多飛快的瞥了一眼失去知覺的博恩斯教授。

eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
